etymology.interpretation: Denotes the activity or sport of climbing rock faces or artificial walls that imitate rock. Conveys movement upward on rocky surfaces requiring strength and technique.

parts.english: to climb; to clamber; to pull oneself up; to seek connections

examples.chinese: 我们周末常去攀岩(我們週末常去攀岩)。
examples.english: We often go rock climbing on weekends.

examples.chinese: 她喜欢在天然岩壁上攀岩(她喜歡在天然岩壁上攀岩)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xǐhuan zài tiānrán yánbì shàng pānyán.
examples.english: She likes to rock climb on natural rock faces.

examples.chinese: 初学者应该先在室内攀岩馆练习(初學者應該先在室內攀岩館練習)。
examples.pinyin: Chūxuézhě yīnggāi xiān zài shìnèi pānyán guǎn liànxí.
examples.english: Beginners should practice in an indoor climbing gym first.
